details.title: Dynamic transmissibility of a complex nonlinear coupling isolator
details.abstract: A mathematical model was developed for a complex nonlinear coupling isolator for attenuating vibration which coupled quadratic damping, viscous damping, Coulomb damping, and nonlinear spring forces. The approximate analytical solution for the dynamic transmissibility of the isolator was deduced by combining Fourier transforms and the harmonic balance method with deterministic excitation. The mathematical characteristics of the dynamic transmissibility were analyzed to illustrate the dynamic performance of the isolator. The analytical results show multiple solutions, especially the low-frequency attenuation characteristics below the resonance frequency. The results provide a theoretical basis for the design of nonlinear isolators.
